titleStmt.title: C. M. Y. Striten et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8795

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his Excellency Jas F Robins^on^ Govenor of Ky Your petitioners would respectfully represent that Robert H. Rankin of this county was fined at the last term of the circuit court for selling whiskey without license and at the time of trial was sick and unable to attend to the defense of the case which if he could have done the result of the trial would probably have been different as set forth in the annexed affidavit as Mr. Rankin is a good citizen we hope your honor will remit the fine

C, M, Y, Striten
Robert Sandford
W, H, Lawrence
G, W, Hardin
Alexandria. Williams
Reuben Leucy
G Armstrong
T. S. Swetnam
S, S, Rowlett
Henry west
John Baum
William Baum
Henry Sparks
George Smoote

I was present at Mr Rankins when the drinking was done for which he was fined the whiskey was bought at Mr Sanders and Mr Rankin had nothing to do with it Mr Sanders hires about three quarters of a mill from Mr Rankins & sold the whsky at his own house given under my hand this May 27/63

Pettn to remit fine
Robert H. Rankin
This pettn does not show in what court fine inflicted nor its amount & no good ground to remit
